definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Weak is the effort of my heart and cold my warmest thought;
sentences.chinese: 我雖竭盡熱誠讚美，仍力薄心冷淡。

sentences.english: They were not welcomed home very  cordially by their mother.
sentences.chinese: 到家以後，母親並不怎麼熱誠地歡迎她們。

sentences.english: We accorded him a hearty welcome.
sentences.chinese: 我們給他以熱誠的歡迎。

sentences.english: The fat man received him with his usual boisterous cordiality.
sentences.chinese: 那胖子以他一貫的興高采烈的熱誠接待了他。

sentences.english: But that expansionary zeal may turn out to be the firm’s Achilles’ heel.
sentences.chinese: 但是那種膨脹性的熱誠或許會成爲這家公司的軟肋。

sentences.english: His enthusiasm is enough to melt a heart of stone.
sentences.chinese: 他的熱誠足以軟化鐵石心腸。

sentences.english: Phinees our father, by being fervent in the zeal of God, received the covenant of an everlasting priesthood.
sentences.chinese: 我們的祖先丕乃哈斯因爲熱誠，才獲永爲司祭的盟約。

sentences.english: He worked for the cause with great zeal.
sentences.chinese: 他懷着極大的熱誠爲理想而努力。

sentences.english: My homestay mother greeted me with cordiality.
sentences.chinese: 我的寄宿家庭媽媽熱誠地迎接我。

sentences.english: Such a petition, fervently presented, will elevate the spirit of all your devotions .
sentences.chinese: 如此熱誠呈獻的禱詞將提升你摯愛之靈。

sentences.english: Do not say the public difficult to measure, leader first contain an enthusiastic heart.
sentences.chinese: 不要說人心難測，領導者首先要有一顆熱誠的心。

sentences.english: This is a subject which requires zeal.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項需要熱誠的任務。

sentences.english: "We hate each other cordially, " says the liberal Mr Balis.
sentences.chinese: 而自由主義者巴利斯說，“我們熱誠的相互恨對方。”

sentences.english: His friends gave him a cordial hug.
We accorded him a heartful welcome.
sentences.chinese: 我們給他以熱誠的歡迎。

sentences.english: Zeal is fit only for wise men, but is found mostly in fools.
sentences.chinese: 熱誠只適宜於智者，但熱誠多半在愚者身上。

definition: to praise/to approve of/to show approval
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
to be dedicated to one's work/to respect one's work
to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to show concern and care for
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
